Article.ArticleTitle: Low-temperature atomic layer deposition of crystalline manganese oxide thin films.

AbstractText: We present a new low-temperature atomic layer deposition (ALD) process based on Mn<sub>2</sub>(CO)<sub>10</sub> and ozone as precursors to fabricate crystalline α-Mn<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> and Mn<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub> thin films; the phase composition is controlled by the deposition temperature such that the former phase forms in the range 60-100 °C and the latter in the range 120-160 °C. In both cases an appreciably high growth rate of ∼1.2 Å per cycle is achieved. The spinel-structured Mn<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub> thin films are shown to be ferrimagnetic with the transition temperature determined to be at ∼47 K.
